results.title: Equality. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Ken Stein, Best Films, New Jersey Public Television, Paul Buck and Art Ciocco
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on the basic areas of economics, ethnic groups, problems of old age and alternate lifestyle. Contains some b&w sequences.

results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Edward Magruder Jones, Mark Robbins, Elspeth MacDougall and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.

results.title: Equalibrium
results.brief_description: One of the layers of this Equalibrium consists of an image of a Sufi like spinning dancer in a white lab coat. This out-take from an earlier film, Phonogramme, had somehow become splattered with a kind of mould that formed small flower like shapes in the frame. It is combined with a loop of hand-painted film which deteriorates slowly each time the loop repeats.

results.title: Equal to the task
results.brief_description: This film show many of the tasks carried out by the Royal Australian Army Service Corps, including transportation, handling and supply of rations, in despatch of supplies, supply of petrol by most modern methods and training of army cooks.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Nicholas Cockram
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
results.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “European Community”.
Deals with the notion of equal work for equal pay. Shows examples of women employed in non-traditional jobs. Encourages girls to look at all areas of employment and suggests that equality of job opportunity should begin at school.

results.title: Epstein
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper, Campbell Harper Films and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: A record of the Memorial Exhibition held in Edinburgh in 1961 of the work of Sir Jacob Epstein. Traces the development of his work and shows many of his well-known pieces - portraits of his family, of children, of many public figures, as well as his powerful symbolic figures including Lucifer, the forerunner to his St Michael on Coventry Cathedral.

results.title: Epsilon
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Fandango, Rolf De Heer and Domenico Procacci
results.brief_description: This unusual early feature from Rolf de Heer is an intergalactic love-story between a woman from the outer space, who is sent from the planet Epsilon to pass judgment on the shameful way in which humans have mishandled their planet, and an earthbound man. Stunning land/nightscapes (the outback, great cities, and vista’s full of stars) are major characters as the two map the spaces, times and places of the heart. Cast includes Ulli Birve and Syd Brisbane.
